00016 #include "stdio.h"
00017 #include "math.h"

00020 /* private includes */
00021 
00022 #include "utility.h"
00023 
00024 #define N_TABLES_MAX 10
00025 #define N_CHAR_STRING 100
00026 
00027 #define MAX 1
00028 #define MIN 2
00029 
00030 
00031 typedef struct Lookup_Table {
00032 
00033   char    table_name[N_CHAR_STRING];  
00034   int     table_ID;
00035   double **ranges;  
00036   float **sum_inputs;
00037   float **sum_results;
00038   long   *count_points;
00039   double  *bin_size;
00040   int     n_dim_in;
00041   int     n_dim_out;
00042   int     n_bins;
00043 
00044 } Lookup_Table;
00045 
00046 
00047 Lookup_Table lookup_tables[N_TABLES_MAX+1];
00048

00053 /*!*****************************************************************************
00054  *******************************************************************************
00055 \note  init_lookup_table
00056 \date  10/20/91 
00057    
00058 \remarks 
00059 
00060         initializes all necessary things
00061 
00062  *******************************************************************************
00063  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00064 
00065  \param[in]     ident      : ident number to be assigned to table
00066  \param[in]     name       : give the table a name
00067  \param[in]     n_dim_in   : how many input dimensions
00068  \param[in]     n_dim_out  : how many output dimensions
00069  \param[in]     n_bins     : how many bins per input dimension
00070 
00071  ******************************************************************************/
00072 int
00073 init_lookup_table(int ident,char *name, int n_dim_in, int n_dim_out, 
00074                   int n_bins,double **ranges)
00075 
00076 {
00077   int i, j, n;
00078   size_t number;
00079   size_t length;
00080   long   all_bins;
00081   
00082 
00083  
00084   /* get memory for this sucker */
00085 
00086   
00087   all_bins = pow((double)n_bins,(double)n_dim_in);
00088 
00089    fprintf(stdout,"Initalize: %s %d %d %d %d %ld\n",
00090            name,
00091            ident,
00092            n_dim_in,
00093            n_dim_out,
00094            n_bins,
00095            all_bins);
00096 
00097 
00098   lookup_tables[ident].sum_inputs = 
00099     my_fmatrix(1,all_bins,1,n_dim_in);
00100   
00101   lookup_tables[ident].sum_results = 
00102     my_fmatrix(1,all_bins,1,n_dim_out);
00103 
00104   lookup_tables[ident].count_points = 
00105     my_livector(1,all_bins);
00106   
00107 
00108   for (i=1; i <= all_bins; ++i) {
00109 
00110     lookup_tables[ident].count_points[i] = 0;
00111 
00112     for (j=1; j<=n_dim_in; ++j) {
00113       lookup_tables[ident].sum_inputs[i][j] = 0.0;
00114     }
00115     for (j=1; j<=n_dim_out; ++j) {
00116       lookup_tables[ident].sum_results[i][j] = 0.0;
00117     }
00118       
00119   }
00120 
00121 
00122   lookup_tables[ident].ranges = my_matrix(1,n_dim_in,1,2);
00123    
00124   lookup_tables[ident].bin_size  = my_vector(1,n_dim_in);
00125 
00126 
00127   for (i=1; i<=n_dim_in; ++i) {
00128 
00129     for (j=1; j<=2; ++j) {
00130 
00131       lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][j] = ranges[i][j];
00132         
00133     }
00134 
00135     /* calculate bin sizes */
00136    
00137     lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i] = 
00138       (ranges[i][MAX] - ranges[i][MIN]) / (double) n_bins;
00139 
00140   }
00141   
00142 
00143   strcpy(lookup_tables[ident].table_name,name);
00144 
00145   lookup_tables[ident].table_ID = ident;
00146 
00147   
00148   lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in  = n_dim_in;
00149   lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_out = n_dim_out;
00150   lookup_tables[ident].n_bins    = n_bins;
00151 
00152   return TRUE;
00153 
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*!*****************************************************************************
00157  *******************************************************************************
00158 \note  add_to_table
00159 \date  August 7, 1993
00160    
00161 \remarks 
00162 
00163         add a value to a given table:
00164         the value is added in the appropriate bin; if the bin is already
00165         occupied, nothing is done (this could be changed to do be an
00166         overwrite or an averaging if necessary in future)
00167 
00168  *******************************************************************************
00169  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00170 
00171  \param[in]     ident : the table ID of the table
00172  \param[in]     in    : the input vector
00173  \param[in]     out   : the output vector
00174  \param[in]     silent: don't print
00175 
00176  ******************************************************************************/
00177 int
00178 add_to_table(int ident,double *in,double *out,int silent)
00179 
00180 {
00181   
00182   int j, i;
00183   long bin=0;
00184   int  iaux=0;
00185   double mult;
00186 
00187 
00188   /* determine the bin in which this point falls */
00189 
00190   mult = 1.0;
00191   bin  = 1;
00192 
00193 
00194   for (i=1; i<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in; ++i) {
00195 
00196     iaux = (in[i] - lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN]) /
00197       lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i] + 1;
00198 
00199     if (iaux > lookup_tables[ident].n_bins) 
00200       iaux = lookup_tables[ident].n_bins;
00201 
00202     if (iaux > lookup_tables[ident].n_bins || iaux < 1) {
00203 
00204       if (!silent) {
00205         printf("Point %d = %f out of table range %f to %f - point not added\n",
00206                i,in[i],lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN],
00207                lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MAX]);
00208       }
00209       
00210       return FALSE;
00211 
00212     }
00213 
00214     bin  += (iaux-1) * mult;
00215     mult *= (double)lookup_tables[ident].n_bins;
00216 
00217   }
00218 
00219 
00220   lookup_tables[ident].count_points[bin] += 1;
00221 
00222   for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_out; ++j) {
00223 
00224     lookup_tables[ident].sum_results[bin][j] += out[j];
00225 
00226   }
00227 
00228   for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in; ++j) {
00229 
00230     lookup_tables[ident].sum_inputs[bin][j] += in[j];
00231 
00232   }
00233 
00234   if (!silent) 
00235     printf("Added values to bin %ld which has now average of %ld values\n",
00236          bin,lookup_tables[ident].count_points[bin]);
00237   
00238   return TRUE;
00239 
00240 }

00243 /*!*****************************************************************************
00244  *******************************************************************************
00245 \note  lookup_in_table
00246 \date  August 7, 1993
00247    
00248 \remarks 
00249 
00250         lookup of a value in a table
00251 
00252  *******************************************************************************
00253  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00254 
00255  \param[in]     ident : the table ID of the table
00256  \param[in]     in    : the input vector
00257  \param[out]    out   : the output vector
00258  \param[out]    center: the vector characterizing the center of the bin
00259  \param[in]     interpolate : interpolate or not
00260  \param[in]     silen : don't print anything
00261 
00262  ******************************************************************************/
00263 int
00264 lookup_in_table(int ident,double *in,double *out,
00265                 double *center, int interpolate,int silent)
00266 
00267 {
00268   
00269   int j, i,n;
00270   long bin=0;
00271   int  iaux=0, irem, iend;
00272   double weight;
00273   static int  nn_bins[100];
00274   static double weights[100];
00275   static double distance_normalization;
00276   static double normalized_remainders[30];
00277   static int    index_bins;
00278   static double mult,mult1;
00279   static long   lookup_bin;
00280   static long   current_bin;
00281   static double sum_weights;
00282 
00283 
00284   /* determine the bin in which this point falls */
00285 
00286   mult = 1.0;
00287   bin  = 1;
00288 
00289   for (i=1; i<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in; ++i) {
00290 
00291     /* if the point lies at the bound of the lookup table in this dimension
00292        and its remainder is towards the bounds, I'll set the remainder
00293        to zero such that the interpolation neglects interpolation in
00294        this direction */
00295 
00296     if ((in[i] - lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN]) <
00297         lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i]/2.               ||
00298         lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MAX] - in[i]  < 
00299         lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i]/2.) {
00300 
00301       normalized_remainders[i] = 0.0;
00302 
00303     } else {
00304 
00305       normalized_remainders[i] = 
00306         fmod((in[i] - lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN]) /
00307          lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i],1.0) - 0.5;
00308 
00309     }
00310 
00311     iaux = (in[i] - lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN]) /
00312       lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i] + 1;
00313 
00314     if (iaux == lookup_tables[ident].n_bins+1) 
00315       iaux = lookup_tables[ident].n_bins;
00316 
00317     if (iaux > lookup_tables[ident].n_bins || iaux < 1) {
00318 
00319       if (!silent) {
00320         printf("Point out of table range:\n");
00321         for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in;++j) {
00322           printf("      %d.input = %f\n",j,in[j]);
00323         }
00324         printf("\n");
00325       }
00326       return FALSE;
00327       
00328     }
00329 
00330     center[i] = lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN] + 
00331       (iaux-0.5) * lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i];
00332 
00333     bin  += (iaux-1) * mult;
00334     mult *= (double)lookup_tables[ident].n_bins;
00335 
00336   }
00337 
00338   lookup_bin = bin;
00339 
00340   if (lookup_tables[ident].count_points[lookup_bin] == 0) {
00341     
00342     if(!silent) {
00343       printf("No data for:\n");
00344       for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in;++j) {
00345         printf("      %d.input = %f\n",j,in[j]);
00346       }
00347       printf("\n");
00348     }
00349     return FALSE;
00350 
00351   }
00352 
00353 
00354   /* interpolate */
00355 
00356   /* first, determine all bins which contribute to interpolation */
00357 
00358 
00359   if (interpolate) {
00360     
00361     /* the members of the hyper cube can be thought of as
00362        binary numbers from 0 to 2^n_in_dim-1; the ONEs are 
00363        treated as a dimension being used, the ZEROs are
00364        dimensions which are not used */
00365 
00366     index_bins = 0;
00367     sum_weights = 0;
00368 
00369     iend = 1 << lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in;
00370     
00371     for (i=0; i< iend ; ++i) {
00372     
00373       mult        = 1;
00374       current_bin = lookup_bin;
00375       iaux        = i;
00376       weight      = 1;
00377 
00378       for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in; ++j) {
00379 
00380         irem  = iaux%2;
00381         iaux /= 2;
00382 
00383         if (irem == 1) {
00384           current_bin += macro_sign(normalized_remainders[j])*mult;
00385           weight *= fabs(normalized_remainders[j]);
00386         } else {
00387           weight *= (1.-fabs(normalized_remainders[j]));
00388         }
00389 
00390         mult *= (double)lookup_tables[ident].n_bins;
00391 
00392       }
00393 
00394    
00395       if (weight != 0.) {
00396 
00397         if (lookup_tables[ident].count_points[current_bin] != 0) {
00398           
00399           nn_bins[++index_bins] = current_bin;
00400           weights[index_bins]   = weight;
00401 
00402           sum_weights += weight;
00403 
00404         }
00405 
00406       }
00407 
00408     }
00409     
00410   } else {
00411 
00412     index_bins = 0;
00413     nn_bins[++index_bins] = lookup_bin;
00414     
00415     weights[index_bins] = 1.0;
00416     sum_weights = 1.0;
00417 
00418   }
00419 
00420   /* the final interpolation */
00421 
00422 
00423   for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_out; ++j) {
00424     out[j] = 0.0;
00425   }
00426   
00427   for (i=1; i<=index_bins; ++i) {
00428     for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_out; ++j) {
00429       out[j] += (lookup_tables[ident].sum_results[nn_bins[i]][j]/
00430                  (double)lookup_tables[ident].count_points[nn_bins[i]]) 
00431         * weights[i];
00432     }
00433   }
00434 
00435   for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_out; ++j) {
00436     out[j] /= sum_weights;
00437   }
00438 
00439   return TRUE;
00440 }

00442 /*!*****************************************************************************
00443  *******************************************************************************
00444 \note  write_lookup_table_ascii
00445 \date  August 7, 1993
00446    
00447 \remarks 
00448 
00449         dumps a lookup table to an ascii file with the table name
00450 
00451  *******************************************************************************
00452  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00453 
00454  \param[in]     ident : the table ID of the table
00455 
00456  ******************************************************************************/
00457 int
00458 write_lookup_table_ascii(int ident)
00459 
00460 
00461 {
00462 
00463   FILE *out;
00464   Lookup_Table  *t;
00465   int i,j;
00466   long   all_bins;
00467   static char   string[100];
00468   
00469   t = &(lookup_tables[ident]);
00470   
00471   all_bins = pow((double)t->n_bins,(double)t->n_dim_in);
00472   
00473   sprintf(string,"%s.ascii",t->table_name);
00474   out = fopen(string,"w");
00475 
00476   if (out == NULL) return FALSE;
00477   
00478   fprintf(out,"%s %d %d %d %d\n",
00479           t->table_name,
00480           t->table_ID,
00481           t->n_dim_in,
00482           t->n_dim_out,
00483           t->n_bins);
00484 
00485   
00486   for (i=1; i<=t->n_dim_in; ++i) {
00487     
00488     fprintf(out,"%f %f %f\n",t->bin_size[i],
00489             t->ranges[i][MIN],t->ranges[i][MAX]);
00490     
00491   }
00492   
00493   for ( i=1; i<=all_bins; ++i) {
00494     
00495     fprintf(out,"%ld    ",t->count_points[i]);
00496       
00497       for (j=1; j<=t->n_dim_in; ++j) {
00498         fprintf(out,"%f ",t->sum_inputs[i][j]);
00499       }
00500       for (j=1; j<=t->n_dim_out; ++j) {
00501         fprintf(out,"%f ",t->sum_results[i][j]);
00502       }
00503 
00504     fprintf(out,"\n");
00505     
00506   }
00507   
00508   fclose(out);
00509 
00510   
00511   return TRUE;
00512     
00513   
00514 }

00516 /*!*****************************************************************************
00517  *******************************************************************************
00518 \note  write_lookup_table
00519 \date  August 7, 1993
00520    
00521 \remarks 
00522 
00523         dumps a lookup table to a biniary format file with the table name
00524 
00525  *******************************************************************************
00526  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00527 
00528  \param[in]     ident : the table ID of the table
00529 
00530  ******************************************************************************/
00531 int
00532 write_lookup_table(int ident)
00533 
00534 
00535 {
00536 
00537   FILE *out;
00538   Lookup_Table  *t;
00539   int i,j;
00540   long   all_bins;
00541   
00542   t = &(lookup_tables[ident]);
00543   
00544   all_bins = pow((double)t->n_bins,(double)t->n_dim_in);
00545   
00546 
00547   out = fopen(t->table_name,"w");
00548 
00549   if (out == NULL) return FALSE;
00550   
00551   if (fwrite(t->table_name,sizeof(char),N_CHAR_STRING,out)!= N_CHAR_STRING) {
00552     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00553     return FALSE;
00554   }
00555   if (fwrite(&(t->table_ID),sizeof(int),1,out)!= 1) {
00556     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00557     return FALSE;
00558   }
00559   if (fwrite(&(t->n_dim_in),sizeof(int),1,out)!= 1) {
00560     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00561     return FALSE;
00562   }
00563   if (fwrite(&(t->n_dim_out),sizeof(int),1,out)!= 1) {
00564     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00565     return FALSE;
00566   }
00567   if (fwrite(&(t->n_bins),sizeof(int),1,out)!= 1) {
00568     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00569     return FALSE;
00570   }
00571 
00572   if (fwrite(&(t->ranges[1][1]),sizeof(double),t->n_dim_in*2,out)!= 
00573       t->n_dim_in*2) {
00574     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00575     return FALSE;
00576   }
00577 
00578   if (fwrite(&(t->bin_size[1]),sizeof(double),t->n_dim_in,out)!= 
00579       t->n_dim_in) {
00580     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00581     return FALSE;
00582   }
00583 
00584   if (fwrite(&(t->count_points[1]),sizeof(long),all_bins,out)!= all_bins) {
00585     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00586     return FALSE;
00587   }
00588 
00589   if (fwrite(&(t->sum_inputs[1][1]),sizeof(float),all_bins*t->n_dim_in,out)!= 
00590       all_bins*t->n_dim_in) {
00591     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00592     return FALSE;
00593   }
00594 
00595   if (fwrite(&(t->sum_results[1][1]),sizeof(float),
00596              all_bins*t->n_dim_out,out)!=all_bins*t->n_dim_out) {
00597     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
00598     return FALSE;
00599   }
00600 
00601   
00602   fclose(out);
00603 
00604   
00605   return TRUE;
00606     
00607   
00608 }

00610 /*!*****************************************************************************
00611  *******************************************************************************
00612 \note  read_lookup_table
00613 \date  August 7, 1993
00614    
00615 \remarks 
00616 
00617         reads a lookup table from an ascii file with the table name
00618 
00619  *******************************************************************************
00620  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00621 
00622  \param[in]     ident : ident number to be assigned
00623  \param[in]     fname : the name of the file containing the table
00624 
00625  ******************************************************************************/
00626 int
00627 read_lookup_table(int ident,char *fname)
00628 
00629 {
00630 
00631   FILE *in;
00632   Lookup_Table  t;
00633   int i,j;
00634   static double bin_size[100];
00635   double **ranges;
00636   long   all_bins;
00637   
00638 
00639 
00640   ranges = my_matrix(1,100,1,2);
00641 
00642 
00643   in = fopen(fname,"r");
00644 
00645   if (in == NULL) return FALSE;
00646   
00647   if (fread(t.table_name,sizeof(char),N_CHAR_STRING,in)!= N_CHAR_STRING) {
00648     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00649     return FALSE;
00650   }
00651   if (fread(&(t.table_ID),sizeof(int),1,in)!= 1) {
00652     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00653     return FALSE;
00654   }
00655   if (fread(&(t.n_dim_in),sizeof(int),1,in)!= 1) {
00656     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00657     return FALSE;
00658   }
00659   if (fread(&(t.n_dim_out),sizeof(int),1,in)!= 1) {
00660     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00661     return FALSE;
00662   }
00663   if (fread(&(t.n_bins),sizeof(int),1,in)!= 1) {
00664     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00665     return FALSE;
00666   }
00667 
00668   if (fread(&(ranges[1][1]),sizeof(double),t.n_dim_in*2,in)!= t.n_dim_in*2) {
00669     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00670     return FALSE;
00671   }
00672 
00673 
00674  /* create the table */
00675 
00676   
00677   init_lookup_table(ident,t.table_name,t.n_dim_in, t.n_dim_out, 
00678                     t.n_bins, ranges);
00679   
00680 
00681   all_bins = pow((double)t.n_bins,(double)t.n_dim_in);
00682   
00683   
00684   /* read the table data */
00685 
00686   if (fread(&(lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[1]),sizeof(double),t.n_dim_in,in)!= 
00687       t.n_dim_in) {
00688     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00689     return FALSE;
00690   }
00691 
00692   if (fread(&(lookup_tables[ident].count_points[1]),sizeof(long),all_bins,in)
00693       != all_bins) {
00694     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00695     return FALSE;
00696   }
00697 
00698   if (fread(&(lookup_tables[ident].sum_inputs[1][1]),sizeof(float),
00699             all_bins*t.n_dim_in,in)!= all_bins*t.n_dim_in) {
00700     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00701     return FALSE;
00702   }
00703 
00704   if (fread(&(lookup_tables[ident].sum_results[1][1]),sizeof(float),
00705             all_bins*t.n_dim_out,in)!= all_bins*t.n_dim_out) {
00706     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
00707     return FALSE;
00708   }
00709 
00710 
00711   fclose(in);
00712 
00713   my_free_matrix(ranges,1,100,1,2);
00714 
00715   return TRUE;
00716     
00717   
00718 }
00719 
00720 /*!*****************************************************************************
00721  *******************************************************************************
00722 \note  read_lookup_table_ascii
00723 \date  August 7, 1993
00724    
00725 \remarks 
00726 
00727         reads a lookup table from an ascii file with the table name
00728 
00729  *******************************************************************************
00730  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00731 
00732  \param[in]     fname : the name of the file containing the table
00733 
00734  ******************************************************************************/
00735 int
00736 read_lookup_table_ascii(int ident,char *fname)
00737 
00738 {
00739 
00740   FILE *in;
00741   Lookup_Table  t;
00742   int i,j;
00743   int rc;
00744   static double bin_size[100];
00745   static double **ranges;
00746   static long   all_bins;
00747   static char   string[100];
00748   
00749 
00750   ranges = my_matrix(1,100,1,2);
00751 
00752   sprintf(string,"%s.ascii",fname);
00753   in = fopen(string,"r");
00754 
00755   if (in == NULL) return FALSE;
00756   
00757   rc = fscanf(in,"%s %d %d %d %d\n",
00758           t.table_name,
00759           &t.table_ID,
00760           &t.n_dim_in,
00761           &t.n_dim_out,
00762           &t.n_bins);
00763 
00764 
00765 
00766   for (i=1; i<=t.n_dim_in; ++i) {
00767     
00768     rc = fscanf(in,"%lf %lf %lf\n",&bin_size[i],
00769            &ranges[i][MIN],&ranges[i][MAX]);
00770     
00771   }
00772     
00773   /* create the table */
00774 
00775   init_lookup_table(ident,t.table_name, t.n_dim_in, 
00776                       t.n_dim_out, t.n_bins, ranges);
00777   
00778 
00779   all_bins = pow((double)t.n_bins,(double)t.n_dim_in);
00780   
00781 
00782   for ( i=1; i<=all_bins; ++i) {
00783     
00784     rc = fscanf(in,"%ld    ",&lookup_tables[ident].count_points[i]);
00785     
00786     for (j=1; j<=t.n_dim_in; ++j) {
00787       rc = fscanf(in,"%f",&lookup_tables[ident].sum_inputs[i][j]);
00788     }
00789     for (j=1; j<=t.n_dim_out; ++j) {
00790       rc = fscanf(in,"%f",&lookup_tables[ident].sum_results[i][j]);
00791     }
00792     
00793   }
00794   
00795   
00796   fclose(in);
00797 
00798   my_free_matrix(ranges,1,100,1,2);
00799 
00800   return TRUE;
00801     
00802   
00803 }
00804 
00805 /*!*****************************************************************************
00806  *******************************************************************************
00807 \note  get_mean_and_center_bin
00808 \date  August 7, 1993
00809    
00810 \remarks 
00811 
00812         returns the input mean value and the input center value of the bin
00813         which belongs to the given input value
00814 
00815         returns FALSE if bin has no data or out of table range
00816 
00817  *******************************************************************************
00818  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00819 
00820  \param[in]     ident : the table ID of the table
00821  \param[in]     in    : the input vector
00822  \param[out]    mean  : the mean input
00823  \param[out]    center: the center value
00824  \param[in]     silent: don't print anything
00825 
00826  ******************************************************************************/
00827 int
00828 get_mean_and_center_bin(int ident,double *in,double *mean,
00829                         double *center, int silent)
00830 
00831 {
00832   
00833   int j, i,n;
00834   long bin=0;
00835   double mult;
00836   long   lookup_bin;
00837   long   iaux;
00838 
00839 
00840   /* determine the bin in which this point falls */
00841 
00842   mult = 1.0;
00843   bin  = 1;
00844 
00845   for (i=1; i<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in; ++i) {
00846 
00847     iaux = (in[i] - lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN]) /
00848       lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i] + 1;
00849 
00850     if (iaux == lookup_tables[ident].n_bins+1) 
00851       iaux = lookup_tables[ident].n_bins;
00852 
00853     if (iaux > lookup_tables[ident].n_bins || iaux < 1) {
00854 
00855       if (!silent) {
00856         printf("Point out of table range:\n");
00857         for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in;++j) {
00858           printf("      %d.input = %f\n",j,in[j]);
00859         }
00860         printf("\n");
00861       }
00862       return FALSE;
00863       
00864     }
00865 
00866     center[i] = lookup_tables[ident].ranges[i][MIN] + 
00867       (iaux-0.5) * lookup_tables[ident].bin_size[i];
00868 
00869     bin  += (iaux-1) * mult;
00870     mult *= (double)lookup_tables[ident].n_bins;
00871 
00872   }
00873 
00874   lookup_bin = bin;
00875 
00876   if (lookup_tables[ident].count_points[lookup_bin] == 0) {
00877     
00878     if(!silent) {
00879       printf("No data for:\n");
00880       for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in;++j) {
00881         printf("      %d.input = %f\n",j,in[j]);
00882       }
00883       printf("\n");
00884     }
00885     return FALSE;
00886 
00887   }
00888 
00889   
00890   for (j=1; j<=lookup_tables[ident].n_dim_in; ++j) {
00891     mean[j] = (lookup_tables[ident].sum_inputs[lookup_bin][j]/
00892                (double)lookup_tables[ident].count_points[lookup_bin]);
00893   }
00894 
00895   return TRUE;
00896 }
